bar.title: Introduction
bar.content:
Tutor-Marker Resources

Welcome to the Centre for Online and Distance Education's Tutor-Marker Resource Center.


Purpose

Tutor-Marking effectively requires not only becoming familiar with the course content and design, but also mastering the tools and techniques used to deliver the course. Tutor-Marking activities throughout the semester vary depending on the how the course was designed. Your job as a tutor-marker is to guide students in learning the course content.


What we can do for you

Whether you are a new or returning tutor-marker we are here to help you through all stages in the delivery of a course.

bar.title: Tutor-Marker Role
bar.content: There are two main roles in the course; a tutor role and a marker role. The tutor role concerns communication with students. The marker role is focused on assessment of students. Each of these roles must be balanced for the duration of the course.

bar.title: Evaluation
bar.content:
Evaluation

Students and TMs evaluation the course at the end of each term. The course supervisor also evaluates the TM. All faculties/departments get a copy of the student evaluation.
